decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressive play with low-cost, powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand. Protection and card advantage are provided by Stubborn Denial and Snapcaster Mage respectively. The deck utilizes a self-damaging strategy with cards like Street Wraith and Thought Scour to enable Death's Shadow to reach high power levels quickly. This deck aims to apply pressure early and finish the opponent off before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on using artifacts to control the game and disrupt opponents, ultimately locking them out of the game with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Chalice of the Void. The deck also has tutoring abilities to search for key pieces like Crucible of Worlds and Engineered Explosives. It utilizes Urza lands and Mox Opal for mana acceleration, while also including cards like Witchbane Orb and Damping Sphere to protect itself from specific strategies. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and win through incremental advantage and disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour to bring back Arclight Phoenix and trigger powerful effects of cards like Thing in the Ice. The deck aims to deal damage in quick bursts using cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Gut Shot, while also controlling the board with Crackling Drake and Pteramander. Surgical Extraction is included to disrupt opponent's strategies and Izzet Charm provides versatile options. The mana base is optimized for casting spells efficiently and consistently.

The main goal of this deck is to assemble the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Scapeshift to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through cards like Search for Tomorrow and Farseek, while using Primeval Titan to search for Valakut and trigger its ability multiple times. Additional cards like Flame Slash and Anger of the Gods provide removal and board control, while cards like Courser of Kruphix help provide card advantage and consistency. Ultimately, the deck aims to win by overwhelming the opponent with direct damage from Valakut triggers.

The main concept of this Dredge deck is to fill the graveyard with cards like Shriekhorn, Faithless Looting, and Life from the Loam, in order to quickly bring back creatures like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam. By utilizing the Dredge mechanic, players can consistently mill their deck and trigger powerful abilities like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate, all while maintaining pressure on the opponent with an aggressive board presence. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a continuous stream of threats and recursive creatures, creating a difficult board state for the opponent to handle.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with spells using card draw and cantrips, while also utilizing discard effects to get Arclight Phoenix into play as quickly as possible. The deck also includes cards like Pyromancer Ascension and Thing in the Ice to create additional threats on the board. The overall strategy is to be aggressive and put pressure on the opponent with the powerful threats in the deck, aiming to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while efficiently removing threats with cards like Fatal Push, Assassin's Trophy, and Maelstrom Pulse. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope to control the board. Combined with efficient beaters like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet, this deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while maintaining control over the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive and efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Kalitas, backed up by disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. Removal spells such as Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy help control the opponent's board while cards like Dark Confidant and Tireless Tracker provide card advantage and threat diversity. The land base is designed to provide consistent mana fixing and disruption, with tools like Field of Ruin to deal with troublesome lands. Overall, this deck aims to apply early pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan effectively.

The deck aims to quickly assemble a combo involving Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw the entire deck, then win the game through Lightning Storm or Laboratory Maniac. It uses cards like Sleight of Hand and Serum Visions to dig for combo pieces, along with acceleration like Lotus Bloom and Simian Spirit Guide. Solemnity and Phyrexian Unlife provide protection against damage, while Pact of Negation ensures the combo resolves safely. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to win out of nowhere once the combo pieces are assembled, making it a potent and unpredictable threat in Modern.

This deck focuses on applying constant pressure to the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By quickly dealing damage and keeping the opponent on the back foot, it aims to win the game as fast as possible before the opponent can stabilize. The combination of efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide, alongside powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Boros Charm, allows the deck to deal consistent damage and close out games quickly. The mana base is built to support the aggressive game plan by providing consistent access to the deck's spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill the board with creatures and trigger powerful effects. By constantly dredging cards into the graveyard with cards like Life from the Loam and Stinkweed Imp, players can quickly get creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast onto the battlefield. The key strategy is to fill the graveyard with cards, then use cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate to deal damage to the opponent and close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive Human creatures to quickly overwhelm opponents. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben disrupts noncreature spells, while Aether Vial allows for creatures to be put into play at instant speed. The mana base is built around maximizing the efficiency of human creatures, with cards like Unclaimed Territory and Cavern of Souls. Thalia's Lieutenant boosts the team, while Reflector Mage provides tempo advantage. Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt opponent's game plan, allowing for Champion of the Parish and Mantis Rider to deal damage efficiently.

The key concept of this UrzaTron Control deck is to assemble the Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine Tron lands to generate large amounts of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Karn Liberated ahead of schedule, while also using control elements such as Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the game early on and then overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and planeswalkers in the mid to late game.

This deck focuses on taking extra turns and disrupting the opponent's game plan. By using cards like Temporal Mastery, Time Warp, and Part the Waterveil, the player can take multiple turns in a row, overwhelming their opponent with card advantage and extra mana. Cards like Gigadrowse and Exhaustion help to tap down the opponent's creatures and lands, giving the player more time to set up their combo. With additional card draw from Howling Mine and Dictate of Kruphix, the player can dig through their deck quickly to find the cards they need to secure victory.

The deck focuses on creating extra turns for the player through a combination of cards like Temporal Mastery, Time Warp, and Part the Waterveil. By taking advantage of cards like Gigadrowse, Exhaustion, and Dictate of Kruphix to slow down the opponent, the deck aims to control the game and win through the advantage gained by the extra turns. Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage provide additional card advantage and versatility to ensure the combo can be executed efficiently. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's game plan and allow for consistent performance.
